meanings.definition: Apartheids: a policy or system of segregation or discrimination on grounds of race.
meanings.sent1: The country abolished apartheids to promote equality among all races.
meanings.sent2: During the era of apartheids, people of different races were kept apart.
meanings.sent3: The idea of having separate schools for each race was an extreme form of apartheids.
meanings.sent4: The apartheids in society created invisible barriers between people based on their race.
meanings.sent5: The impact of apartheids on society was profound and long-lasting.

meanings.sent3: The apartheids between the two rival groups at school was evident during lunchtime.
